commands.name: create
commands.description: Create a new character you will control!
commands.long_description: Only one character can be linked to a player. Game Masters can create NPCs.

parameters.name: character name
parameters.description: The name you wish to give your character. Spaces supported.

commands.name: me
commands.description: Prints out your character info. GMs can use a slug to get a certain character.

commands.name: skill
commands.description: This command can be used to create a new skill for your character (creation is for GMs only)

parameters.name: skillname
parameters.description: The name of the skill to check

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the skill to

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A player slug to create this skill for

commands.name: set
commands.description: Sets a characters values to a new value
commands.long_description: This can only be used by Game Masters.

parameters.name: skill
parameters.description: The skill to update the value of. For main skills you can use abbreviations

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the skill to

commands.name: check
commands.description: Use this command to perform a check against a specific skill. All modifiers will be applied
commands.long_description: Append an `a` or `d` to the end of your command to add advantage or disadvantage to your roll.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to set the skill to

commands.name: stability
commands.description: Roll a stability check and if you fail, roll a dice for stability damage!
commands.long_description: For GMs, use `<pref>stability <slug> <dice roll>` to roll for any player in your guild.

parameters.name: dice roll
parameters.description: The dice roll to roll on a failed check.

commands.name: initiative
commands.description: When initiative is active, use this to roll your initiative with or without advantage/disadvantage.

parameters.name: mod
parameters.description: Whether to apply advantage/disadvantage. Use `a` and `d`

commands.name: improve
commands.description: This triggers an upgrade of all the skills you've passed. When you run this command your GM has to react to the bots response to approve the improvement.
commands.long_description: All skills that you have passed will have a chance of upgrading.

commands.name: start
commands.description: This command starts the game for this guild. Successful rolls are stored.

commands.name: end
commands.description: This command ends the game for this guild. Successful rolls are no longer stored.

commands.name: roll
commands.description: This command rolls the dice configuration you define. Don't use spaces!

parameters.name: dice_format
parameters.description: The dice config to roll. e.g. 3d10+4

commands.name: startinit
commands.description: Command for Game Masters to start initiative rolls in this game.

commands.name: endinit
commands.description: Command for Game Masters to end initiative rolls in this game.

commands.name: activate
commands.description: Command for Game Masters to activate a character to be included in initiative

commands.name: deactivate
commands.description: Command for Game Masters to deactivate a character to be included in initiative

commands.name: xp
commands.description: This command rolls the dice configuration you define and gives XP to the people you mentioned. Don't use spaces!

parameters.name: dice_format
parameters.description: The dice config to roll. e.g. 3d10+4

parameters.name: mentions
parameters.description: Mention the people whose characters you want to give XP to.

commands.name: mark
commands.description: Use this command to mark a skill as passed for a character.

parameters.name: character_slug
parameters.description: The character to mark a skill as passed for.

commands.name: unmark
commands.description: Use this command to unmark a skill as passed for a character.

parameters.name: character_slug
parameters.description: The character to unmark a skill as passed for.

commands.name: clean
commands.description: Clean recent messages from the bot and commands to do with the bot.

commands.name: invite
commands.description: Get invite link for this bot

commands.name: help
commands.description: View available commands to use with this bot and get help with specific commands

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The specific command to get help for, use the name of the command e.g. `check`
